intro: Appendicula bifaria, commonly known as the two-lobed appendicula, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Ericaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in Chile and Argentina. The plant is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It grows in rocky or acidic soils and is often found in high-altitude environments. Appendicula bifaria is a perennial shrub that produces small, elliptical leaves with a leathery texture.
